d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (12:13): fwiw on hgroup/subhead I would suggest it subline rather than subhead, historically/in print headlines are broken into mainline, subline, etc. subhead sounds like it should be used in header. to me h1-h6 are about headlines, not headers (as headers are described in html5)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:15): d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631: Sure, <subhead> might not be the best name
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:15): Would you also call it a subline if it came before the main heading?
f94f854949fc94f06c85986f1e814b34 (12:16): what is your favourite auth* method between application and API?
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (12:17): yeah, well, as i understand it the mainline is the one with the name rather than the other way round
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:17): d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631: Yeah, I think that works poorly in markup though
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:18): On an entirely diffferent topic, can anyone explain contentEditable to me? Does it ever change the innerHTML of the contentEditable element?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:18): It doesn't seem to in the live dom viewer...
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (12:18): anything that matches foo@bar will become a link
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:19): Hmm, the spec suggests that it should change the innerHTML
d114be1698421a7cec050e2207d29631 (12:20): and maybe other link like text too, but i know it happens with email like text
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:20): Hard to see how it would work otherwise, really
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:21): gets something working a little
5326767ae9a81f600773919a6ec26831 (12:28): is there a good way to get the text ascent and descent from a context2d? It would help greatly in positioning text vertically.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:35): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, just press ctrl+b or some such
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:35): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, contenteditable is very much live
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:35): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, e.g. http://annevankesteren.nl/test/contenteditable-style.htm :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:35): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: Right. I am just having cross-browser issues and weird behaviour
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:36): trying to script it
5326767ae9a81f600773919a6ec26831 (12:36): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c : that is unfortunate, wouldn't you say?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:36): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, ah yeah, it does not really work that well
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:37): now has a testcase that fails to reproduce the original bug :(
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (12:37): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I'm the whatwg styles dude‚Ä¶
5326767ae9a81f600773919a6ec26831 (12:38): is there a compelling reason to not expose the font ascent & descent?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:38): d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40: Yeah. Is this re: the request for a prettier implementor spec?

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:39): 5326767ae9a81f600773919a6ec26831: Yeah - probably extra fields will be added to TextMetrics, but the plan was to wait until browsers had better support for all the current features before adding even more, I think
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (12:39): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: I saw you talking to paul_irish, I was more just saying whatup than anything else

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:39): 5326767ae9a81f600773919a6ec26831: I don't think there's a reason to not expose it, except for the usual complexity involved with adding features and the desire not to do too much at once
5326767ae9a81f600773919a6ec26831 (12:40): ah OK. I am attempting to write a game in HTML5 using canvas, and positioning text gets a bit tricky.
d6e292711389fc8c3d399cd640fc8a40 (12:40): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: but basically, I want to get the developer spec further along, then‚Äîtotally
5326767ae9a81f600773919a6ec26831 (12:40): For now, I'll just figure out the ascent by hand and hard-code it.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (12:41): 5326767ae9a81f600773919a6ec26831: If you need more vertical control than textBaseline gives, hardcoding sizes is the only way
5326767ae9a81f600773919a6ec26831 (12:44): yeah, that seems to be it.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:03): the html5lib sanitizer hasn't had its white lists updated in a long time
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:03): event-source and m are allowed. mark and track aren't.
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:04): the MathML and SVG element whitelists look suspiciously short
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:09): (that it hasn't been updated for a long time)
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:10): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: something I could look at? I didnt understand the context of your comment)
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:11): (I don't mind if the answer is no:-)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:11): e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173: http://code.google.com/p/html5lib/source/browse/python/html5lib/sanitizer.py?r=0f459d1384d64e579fa9a3887cd5a9bf94f497f1
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:13): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: this is sanitize as in make safe for comment input etc?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:14): e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173: the context is that I'm gathering requirements for the HTML sanitizer for Firefox 4.next
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:15): e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173: we want to allow safe MathML, so I will need a whitelist of safe MathML elements

e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:18): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: just looking over list by eye, if its immediate use is firefox then you don't want mml3 elements yet so I'll hold back on that comment, you should perhaps allow href as well as xlink:href (depending on outcome of that open  mozilla bug) oh menclose is missing from the elements
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:19): e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173: it's unclear to me if I should want to drop mml3 presentation elements or any semantic elements
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:21): the html5lib white lists have odd stuff. e.g. attributes ch and pqg for HTML

e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:25): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: well yes mathml doesn't include anything like script so pretty much any of it is safe, just some of it doesn't work in some browsers, so it depends what the intention behind the whitelist is. I wouldn't argue too much if firefox whitelist just presentation mathml2 and so by implication blacklisted content mathml  and all of mathml3 new stuff, if it is just restricting things like form input, rather than restricting what's in the body of
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:25): the page., on the other hand if you allow all of mathml3 presentation and content then I don't think that is unsafe?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:25): e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173: can MathML do form input?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:26): e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173: the goal for Firefox is to drop stuff that's not safe to transfer across an Origin boundary
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:26): people often request it, but now the idea would be to use mtext containing an html form element (and pray it works:-0
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:27): the only mathml element that can do anything interesting (other than displaying interesting characters in intersting layouts) is maction
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:27): whose behaviour is largely implementation defined
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:28): "implemetation defined" always sounds bad for Web specs
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:28): I only said that to wind you up
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:29): to add to the pain, i'll mention that the implementation behaviour is thus controlled by namespaced attributes in a vendor namespace
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (13:29): in my impl, <maction> sends an email to e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 with viagra spam
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:29): oh please, i hope it's not too expensive
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:29): is <maction actiontype="input"> like contenteditable?
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:30): I'd have to check what firefox makes of it, but to be honest if you wanted to not worry about it i'd zap maction
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:30): e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173: the four built-in maction actiontypes look harmless enough
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:31): e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173: vendor-namespace stuff is not going to be allowed
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:31): by the sanitizer
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:31): OK then you should be OK
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:32): e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173: does MathML have attributes whose content is passed to a CSS parser?

e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:34): not by definition, but some parts of the mathml implementation work internally by the browser applying a css stylesheet matching certain attribute values (I think)

e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:35): if you go <mi mathcolor="....">  the .... is a css compatible color so "red" or #123456 or something, but whether it actually goes through the css parser you are in a better position to check

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:35): btw, the main reason I can think of against white listing Semantic MathML is code footprint, since there's no other reason for the product to contain the names of Semantic MathML elements (as long as rendering isn't supported)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:35): e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173: I'm mostly worried about stuff that can use the CSS url(...) expression
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:35): yeas as i say. I don't think it would be unreasonable for firefox to restrict to what works as well as what is safe
e83147fdd1c7a8c2b85b2d842011b173 (13:36): no only colours and lengths have any resemblance to css
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:44): The requirement doc is https://wiki.mozilla.org/Platform/HTML5_sanitizer
